ARABIC: قَالَ كَلَّآ إِنَّ مَعِىَ رَبِّى سَيَهْدِينِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He said, 'Never! My Lord is with me and He will guide me.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Moses replied: "By no means. My Lord is with me. He will show me the way."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Moses said: "Certainly not. My Lord is with me; He will direct me."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: When the two groups came close to each other, the companions of Moses said, "We will be caught".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Said Moosa, “Never! Indeed my Lord is with me, He will now show me the way.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: (Musa) said: "Nay, verily with me is my Lord. He will guide me."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He said: By no means; surely my Lord is with me: He will show me a way out.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Said he, 'No indeed; surely my Lord is with me; He will guide me.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He said: Nay, verily! for lo! my Lord is with me. He will guide me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Moses replied, "No, My Lord is with me, and He will guide me."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Musa said: by no means; verily with me is my Lord; He shall guide me.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: He said, ‘Certainly not! Indeed my Lord is with me. He will guide me.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (Moses) said: "By no means! my Lord is with me! Soon will He guide me!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: [Musa (Moses)] said: "Nay, verily! With me is my Lord, He will guide me."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: No, indeed' he replied, 'my Lord is with me and He will guide me'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He said, “No; my Lord is with me, He will guide me.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [Moses] said, "No! Indeed, with me is my Lord; He will guide me."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:62] He, Moses, said, ‘Certainly not!, they shall not catch us up; indeed I have my Lord with me, to provide assistance. He will guide me’, to the route of deliverance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (He said) Moses said: (Nay) they have not, (verily! for lo! my Lord is with me. He will guide me) He will save me from them and guide me to the right way.
